citation.article-title: Xylanibacterium ulmi gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel xylanolytic member of the family Promicromonosporaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Xylanibacterium (Xy.la.ni.bac.te′ri.um. N.L. neut. n. xylanum xylan, a polysaccharide; N.L. neut. n. bacterium from Gr. neut. n. baktron small rod; N.L. neut. n. Xylanibacterium xylan-hydrolysing small rod).
Aerobic or facultatively anaerobic, chemo-organotrophic and xylanolytic.
Phylogenetically related to members of the family Promicromonosporaceae.
Cell-wall sugars are galactose and rhamnose.
Major menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-8(H4); predominant fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0 (12-methyltetradecanoic acid).
Contains PG, DPG, PI, PIM and other unidentified phosphoglycolipids.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 72·3 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Xylanibacterium ulmi.
